text.div:
Timing Logical Model

A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing offers a choice of multiple OccurrenceTime (used is used to specify specific times), or recurrence patterns.

name: Timing
title: shr-core-Timing
description:
A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times.
Timing offers a choice of multiple OccurrenceTime (used is used to specify specific times), or recurrence patterns.

element.definition:
A timing schedule that specifies an event that may occur multiple times.
Timing offers a choice of multiple OccurrenceTime (used is used to specify specific times), or recurrence patterns.

element.short: The point in time in which something happens.
element.definition: The point in time in which something happens.

element.short: A code for the timing schedule.
element.definition:
A code for the timing schedule.
Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

element.short: The length of the recurring event.
element.definition: The length of the recurring event.

element.short: A set of rules that describe when a recurring event is scheduled.
element.definition: A set of rules that describe when a recurring event is scheduled.

element.short: The start and end of the overall recurrence pattern in terms of dates/times or in terms of number of repeats. Could also be an event, such as when all doses are taken.
element.definition: The start and end of the overall recurrence pattern in terms of dates/times or in terms of number of repeats. Could also be an event, such as when all doses are taken.
